topic_metadata.title: How to hang the first line indented？

posts.name: HenYu
posts.cooked:
If there is a piece of text, how can I turn it into an indented style like the first line hanging in word.

Snipaste_2024-10-04_03-30-171109×621 32.3 KB
posts.raw:
If there is a piece of text, how can I turn it into an indented style like the first line hanging in word.

![Snipaste_2024-10-04_03-30-17|690x386](upload://o1OkbtlhL9ZVBLfkcNp1SmUeR3C.png)

posts.name: Kevio
posts.cooked:
You have a few options here:

  • If you want to replicate your example image precisely, you should use an enumerated list which automatically features a hanging indent.
  • In normal paragraphs, you can set the hanging-indent parameter which will indent all but the first line.
  • Maybe you want to also, or exclusively, indent the first line in which case there’s a first-line-indent parameter¹.
#set page(width: 9cm, height: auto)

// No indentation at all:
People are not born knowing the truth, who can be without doubt.

// Hanging indentation as part of the enumerated list:
+ People are not born knowing the truth, who can be without doubt.

#set par(hanging-indent: 1em)

// Paragraph hanging indentation:
People are not born knowing the truth, who can be without doubt.

#set par(first-line-indent: 1em, hanging-indent: 0em)

// Paragraph first-line indentation:
People are not born knowing the truth, who can be without doubt.

¹Behavior of first line indentation in paragraphs seems limiting · Issue #311 · typst/typst · GitHub
posts.raw:
You have a few options here:

- If you want to replicate your example image precisely, you should use an enumerated list which automatically features a hanging indent.
- In normal paragraphs, you can set the `hanging-indent` parameter which will indent all **but** the first line.
- Maybe you want to also, or exclusively, indent the first line in which case there's a `first-line-indent` parameter¹.

```typ
#set page(width: 9cm, height: auto)

// No indentation at all:
People are not born knowing the truth, who can be without doubt.

// Hanging indentation as part of the enumerated list:
+ People are not born knowing the truth, who can be without doubt.

#set par(hanging-indent: 1em)

// Paragraph hanging indentation:
People are not born knowing the truth, who can be without doubt.

#set par(first-line-indent: 1em, hanging-indent: 0em)

// Paragraph first-line indentation:
People are not born knowing the truth, who can be without doubt.
```

![image|506x369](upload://aW25zW6poUcmvaIRD7Sr0RBgX6n.png)

¹https://github.com/typst/typst/issues/311

posts.cooked:
xkevio:
#set par(first-line-indent: 1em, hanging-indent: 0em)

I want to point out that hanging-indent in this case doesn’t have to be explicitly set, since it’s set to 0pt by default. It’s also more common to zero-out something by using 0pt.
posts.raw:
[quote="xkevio, post:2, topic:911"]
```typ
#set par(first-line-indent: 1em, hanging-indent: 0em)
```
[/quote]

I want to point out that [`hanging-indent`](https://typst.app/docs/reference/model/par/#parameters-hanging-indent) in this case doesn't have to be explicitly set, since it's set to `0pt` by default. It's also more *common* to zero-out something by using `0pt`.

posts.name: Kevio
posts.cooked: In this case, it does have to be set since this represents code from the same document. If it was a stand-alone declaration, you would be correct.
posts.raw: In *this* case, it does have to be set since this represents code from the same document. If it was a stand-alone declaration, you would be correct.
